title: In Munich, Europe Says It Is ‘De-risking’ From the U.S. Amid Trump’s Unpredictability
summary: In Munich, European leaders were also talking about “de-risking” from the United States, citing President Trump’s unpredictability.

title: Thousands Rally for Iran Regime Change in Cities Around the World
summary: People protesting the Iranian government gathered near the security conference in Munich, as well as in other cities. More U.S.-Iran talks are expected Tuesday.

title: Navalny Was Poisoned With Frog Toxin, European Governments Say
summary: The toxin was found in the body of the Russian dissident Aleksei A. Navalny, who died in prison two years ago, five governments said, challenging Russia’s official account.

title: Inside the Debacle That Led to the Closure of El Paso’s Airspace
summary: The F.A.A., citing “a grave risk of fatalities” from a new technology being used on the Mexican border, got caught in a stalemate with the Pentagon, which deemed the weapon “necessary.”

title: Trump Erased the Endangerment Finding. Here Come the Lawsuits.
summary: The battle is expected to reach the Supreme Court, which is far more conservative today than it was when the measure was established.

title: New U.S. Boat Strike Kills 3 in the Caribbean
summary: The attacks since early November had specifically targeted suspected drug smuggling boats in the Pacific Ocean.

title: How ICE Failed to Justify the Shooting of Julio Sosa-Celis in Minneapolis
summary: The collapse of the Trump administration’s version of events in the case was only the most recent instance in which officials gave an account of a shooting that was later contradicted.

title: How ICE Is Pushing Tech Companies to Identify Protesters
summary: The DHS is flooding social media companies with administrative subpoenas to identify accounts that are protesting ICE. Social media companies have pushed back but are largely complying. Our tech reporter, Sheera Frenkel, explains.

title: Sick Detainees Describe Poor Care at CoreCivic ICE Facilities
summary: Problems at detention centers operated by CoreCivic extend far beyond recent measles outbreaks.

title: What We Know About the Kidnapping of Nancy Guthrie, Savannah Guthrie’s Mother
summary: Nancy Guthrie, 84, the “Today” show anchor’s mother, vanished from her Arizona home on Feb. 1. In the time since, very little new information has come to light.

title: Their Secret to a Happy Marriage? A Translation App
summary: He speaks English. She speaks Mandarin. The secret to their happy marriage: Microsoft Translator.

title: Bondi’s Incompetence Is the Latest Insult for Epstein’s Victims
summary: The attorney general’s behavior reveals a deeper rot in the American justice system.

title: A Love Letter to the Beating Heart
summary: The heart is not romance; it’s the organ that guards the line between life and death.

title: French Prosecutors to Investigate Diplomat as Part of Epstein Probe
summary: The Paris prosecutor’s office said it was looking into three new complaints with links to the files and revisiting an earlier investigation into an Epstein associate who died in 2022.

title: Ring Ends Deal to Link Neighborhood Cameras After Backlash to Super Bowl Ad
summary: A commercial about a lost dog being reunited with his family ignited concerns that a “Search Party” feature posed privacy risks. Ring parted ways with the tech company Flock Safety.

title: The Sea Took Her Prosthetic Leg. Months Later, It Gave It Back.
summary: Brenda Ogden lost her waterproof prosthetic leg 10 months ago, and with it, her zest for swimming. Then a local fossil hunter stumbled upon it.
